stories.text:
WTF Instagram!

Earlier this week something unusual greeted me. I got logged out of my Instagram account. It appeared strange so I attempted to log back in and it displayed user not found. I was confused, was it a hack, was my account compromised. nothing appeared to work.

I quickly hopped on google and after a number of searches got a link to send a message to Instagram or meta support inquiring WTF is happening. After a day or so I got a response my account was disabled, and a link to their terms of use.

Now the account in question is my personal account. it is private I only share or post personal stuff with close family and friends why will I be in violation?

When I attempted to reset my account I noticed it directed me to a page but the email and phone number were not mine.

And this just got me thinking Instagram needs users, and users should also have rights. A vague email with terms and service violations is shameful. If I violated your terms let me know the terms I violated. If my account was compromised and you are punishing me I don't think that is right.

I will love to get input from others who have experienced similar experiences with Instagram.

One love.
